TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy-skeletal, mixed, superactive Typic Humicryepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Springcamp silt loam on a west northwest facing linear, concave backslope, on a slope of 28 percent at an elevation of 113 m (The soil was moist from 0 to 35 cm and 41 to 150 cm, and wet, non-satiated, from 35 to 41 cm when described on July 19, 2016.)
Oe--0 to 3 cm; moderately decomposed plant material, dark gray (7.5YR 4/1) dry, black (7.5YR 2.5/1) moist; nonsticky, nonplastic; many very fine and common fine and medium roots; very strongly acid (pH 4.8); clear smooth boundary
A1--3 to 10 cm; silt loam, dark gray (7.5YR 4/1) dry, black (7.5YR 2.5/1) moist; weak fine granular structure; very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; many very fine and common fine and medium roots; strongly acid (pH 5.3); clear smooth boundary
A2--10 to 22 cm; silt loam, brown (7.5YR 4/2) dry, very dark brown (7.5YR 2.5/2) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure; friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; many very fine and common fine roots; common very fine and few fine irregular pores; 1 percent gravel; moderately acid (pH 5.8); clear irregular boundary
2Bw--22 to 41 cm; very gravelly loam, grayish brown (10YR 5/2) dry, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; weak medium granular structure; friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; common very fine roots; few fine irregular pores; 40 percent gravel; moderately acid (pH 5.9); clear smooth boundary
2C--41 to 75 cm; extremely gravelly loam, light brownish gray (2.5Y 6/2) dry, dark grayish brown (2.5Y 4/2) moist; massive; friable, slightly sticky, nonplastic; 60 percent gravel; moderately acid (pH 5.9); clear irregular boundary
3Cr--75 to 150 cm;

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Nome Census Area, Alaska, latitude 63.6120850, longitude -160.8824000 degrees, datum WGS84 (coordinates determined with a GPS unit)

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES:
*Atayak--deep to lithic contact, no channers present; escarpments on plains
*Tolstoipoint--very deep; mountain slopes

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
*Elevation--25 to 200 m
*Climate--warm, moist summers; cold, dry winters
*Mean annual precipitation--300 to 365 mm
*Mean annual air temperature-- -5 to -1 degrees C
*Frost-free period--55 to 90 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
*Cranberryslough--permafrost present, histic epipedon, aquic soil moisture regime, gelic soil temperature regime, saddles on hills
*Nikaat--permafrost present, histic epipedon, aquic soil moisture regime, gelic soil temperature regime, loess covered terraces and plains

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
*Drainage class--well drained
*Saturation during normal years--none
*Saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat)--high to moderately high throughout the profile

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Use--wildlife habitat, recreation, subsistence
